Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
NAICS Translation: 336111: Automobile Manufacturing
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Aleris International Inc. and 13 of its subsidiaries committed to implementing environmental improvements and controls projected to cost $4.2 million at 15 plants located in 11 states. The company also agreed to a $4.6 million civil penalty to resolve violations of the Clean Air Act.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/aluminum-recycler-agrees-resolve-clean-air-act-violations

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 423930: Recyclable Material Merchant Wholesalers
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The NRC issued a Notice of Violation and Proposed Imposition of a Civil Penalty in the amount of $7,000 to Novelis Corporation for a Severity Level III violation. The violation involved the deliberate repairs of a nuclear gauge that were not permitted under the terms of Novelis' NRC License.
Info Source: http://www.nrc.gov/docs/ML1613/ML16133A089.pdf

Description: The EPA and the Department of Justice announced a settlement resolving Clean Air Act claims by the United States and the states of Kansas and Louisiana against carbon black manufacturer Columbian Chemicals Company. The company agreed to install and operate state-of-the-art pollution control technologies costing about $94 million, spend $375,000 on environmental mitigation projects and pay a civil penalty of $650,000.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/reference-news-release-epa-doj-announce-settlement-carbon-black-producer-columbian
https://www.fra.dot.gov/Elib/Document/17839

Description: Aleris agreed to pay a civil penalty of $4.6 million to a group of ten states and the federal government to resolve Clean Air Act violations at its aluminum recycling plants. This was part of a larger $8.8 million settlement also announced by the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-aleris-international-inc
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/aluminum-recycler-agrees-resolve-clean-air-act-violations

Description: Columbia Chemicals agreed to pay $195,000 each to Kansas and Louisiana to resolve alleged violations at its carbon black facilities. This was part of a larger $95 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-columbian-chemicals-company
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/reference-news-release-epa-doj-announce-settlement-carbon-black-producer-columbian
